verses.roman:
akrūra āgataḥ kiṁ vā
yaḥ kaṁsasyārtha-sādhakaḥ
yena nīto madhu-purīṁ
kṛṣṇaḥ kamala-locanaḥ

synonyms: akrūraḥ—Akrūra; āgataḥ—has come; kim vā—perhaps; yaḥ—who; kaṁsasya—of King Kaṁsa; artha—of the purpose; sādhakaḥ—the executor; yena—by whom; nītaḥ—brought; madhu-purīm—to Mathurā City; kṛṣṇaḥ—Kṛṣṇa; kamala—lotuslike; locanaḥ—whose eyes.
translation: "Perhaps Akrūra has returned—he who fulfilled Kaṁsa's desire by taking lotus-eyed Kṛṣṇa to Mathurā.

purport.content: The gopīs angrily spoke this statement.
